q1.question: What's the difference between Desktop and Server versions?
q1.intro: Hagicode offers two deployment options: Desktop version and Server version. Each has its advantages, but both adopt a user-controlled server and data approach, providing better data protection.
q1.desktop1: Runs locally on your computer, more lightweight
q1.desktop2: No server configuration needed, ready to use out of the box
q1.desktop3: Suitable for individual developers and light usage scenarios
q1.server1: Can be deployed on remote servers
q1.server3: Better suited for team collaboration and scaling
q1.server4: Prepares for future enterprise features and multi-device sync
q1.conclusion: Whichever version you choose, you have complete control over your server and data, enjoying better privacy protection and data security.

q2.question: What do I need to do after installation?
q2.intro: Hagicode Desktop is essentially a launcher. On first launch after installation, it will guide you through these steps:
q2.step1: Download Hagicode Core: Desktop will automatically detect and prompt you to download Hagicode core components
q2.step2: Install Core Components: Follow the on-screen prompts to complete core component installation
q2.step3: Configure AI Coding Assistant: Configure assistants like Claude Code as needed
q2.note: The entire process has clear guidance in the Desktop interface. Please ensure network connection on first launch to complete core component download.
q2.done: After completing these steps, you can use all Hagicode Desktop features normally.

q3.question: How do I check for updates?
q3.answer: Desktop automatically checks for updates. When a new version is available, a prompt will appear in the top right corner of the interface. You can also manually check for updates in "Settings".

q4.question: Which AI models are supported?
q4.intro: Hagicode Desktop provides powerful AI coding assistant support through Agent CLI:
q4.upcoming: Coming Soon: Copilot, Gemini, Kimi Code, and other CLI Agents
q4.closing: We are actively expanding support for more AI coding assistants. Stay tuned for future updates.

q5.question: Does it support offline usage?
q5.intro: Yes! Hagicode Desktop supports complete offline usage:
q5.point1: Network connection required for initial installation and configuration (downloading core components and AI models)
q5.point2: All features can be used offline after configuration
q5.point3: Your code and data are never uploaded to the cloud
q5.point4: All AI processing is completed locally

q6.question: How to get help when encountering issues?
q6.intro: If you encounter issues while using Hagicode Desktop, you can get help through:
q6.point2: Online Documentation: View complete usage documentation and tutorials
q6.point3: GitHub Issues: Submit issue reports in the project repository

container.title: Hagicode Container - Container Deployment
container.description: Deploy Hagicode via Docker Compose Builder. Simple configuration, ready to use. Supports multiple image sources and auto updates.

hero.title: Hagicode Container
hero.tagline: Deploy quickly with Docker Compose Builder, simple configuration, ready to use

isolation.title: Environment Isolation
isolation.description: Containerized deployment avoids dependency conflicts, doesn't affect system environment, keeps system clean

simple.title: Simple Configuration
simple.description: Use Docker Compose Builder for visual configuration, no need to write complex scripts

crossPlatform.title: Cross-Platform Support
crossPlatform.description: Supports x86_64 architecture, suitable for various servers and cloud platforms

persistent.title: Data Persistence
persistent.description: Supports Volume mounting, secure and reliable data, no data loss on container restart

autoUpdate.title: Auto Updates
autoUpdate.description: Supports watchtower for automatic updates, easily get the latest version

productionReady.title: Production Ready
productionReady.description: Designed for production environments, supports high availability and horizontal scaling

builder.title: Docker Compose Builder
builder.subtitle: The simplest and recommended container deployment method

visual.title: Visual Configuration
visual.description: Configure all parameters through a friendly Web interface, no need to manually edit YAML files

generate.title: One-Click Configuration Generation
generate.description: Automatically generate complete docker-compose.yml files with best practice configurations

deploy.title: Fast Deployment
deploy.description: One-click download configuration files and start services, complete deployment in minutes

secure.title: Secure and Reliable
secure.description: Built-in security best practices, automatically configures data volumes and restart policies

mirrors.title: Image Source Selection
mirrors.description: Choose the most suitable image source based on your network environment and location
mirrors.dockerHubDesc: The world's largest container image registry, suitable for international network users
mirrors.azureDesc: Microsoft Azure's image service, faster access from China
mirrors.aliyunDesc: Aliyun's domestic image acceleration, recommended for users in mainland China

q1.question: What's the difference between Container and Desktop versions?
q1.intro: Both versions have their advantages. You can choose based on your usage scenario:
q1.desktop1: Runs locally on your computer, more lightweight
q1.desktop2: No server configuration needed, ready to use out of the box
q1.desktop3: Suitable for individual developers and light usage scenarios
q1.container1: Can be deployed on servers, supports remote access
q1.container2: Environment isolation, doesn't affect system environment
q1.container3: Better suited for team collaboration and production environments
q1.container4: Supports automated deployment and horizontal scaling

q2.question: What is Docker Compose Builder?
q2.intro: Docker Compose Builder is our visual configuration tool that helps you:
q2.point1: Configure all container parameters through a Web interface
q2.point3: Built-in best practices and security configurations
q2.note: No need to manually write complex YAML configurations. Even Docker beginners can deploy easily.

q3.question: Which system architectures does the container version support?
q3.answer: Hagicode container images currently support x86_64 (amd64) architecture, suitable for most servers and PCs.
q3.note: Docker will automatically select the appropriate architecture for your system when pulling images.

q4.question: How to update the container?
q4.intro: When using Docker Compose deployment, updating is very simple:
q4.watchtower: Or use Watchtower for automatic updates.

q5.question: How to configure data persistence?
q5.intro: Docker Compose Builder automatically configures data volumes. By default, your data will be stored in Docker Volumes, ensuring:
q5.point1: Data is not lost when containers are deleted
q5.point2: Data is preserved during container upgrades

q6.question: What to do if container startup fails?
q6.intro: Steps to troubleshoot container startup failure:

step3.title: Check port occupancy:
step3.desc: If your service port is 3000, use this command to check:
step3.solution: If the port is occupied, you can:
step3.solution1: Stop the process occupying the port
step3.solution2: Or configure a different port in Docker Compose Builder

q6.help: If the issue persists, please check the detailed documentation or contact technical support.
